title: Make About the default landing page, update About hero copy, improve mobile responsiveness, and replace booking CTAs with persistent WhatsApp chat (draft only)

requirements.text: Set the About page as the default landing page when visiting the root domain path ('/'), so entering the domain loads the About content by default.

quotes: Set the About section as the default landing page when someone enters my domain in the browser.

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting '/' shows the About page content as the initial view (without requiring the user to click navigation).
Direct navigation to existing routes (e.g., /services, /case-studies) continues to work.

requirements.text: Reorder the global site navigation so that the About link appears first in the navigation sequence (desktop and mobile).

quotes: Reorder the site navigation so the About section appears first in the sequence.

acceptanceCriteria: In the header desktop navigation, the first nav item is 'About'.
In the mobile menu navigation, the first nav item is 'About'.
In the footer 'Quick Links' section, the first item shown is 'About' (and the ordering matches the new nav order).

requirements.text: Update the About page to remove the heading text “About Me” entirely and ensure the words “About Me” do not appear anywhere on the About page.

quotes: Remove the heading “About Me” completely.
Do not display the words “About Me” anywhere on the About page.

acceptanceCriteria: The About page contains no visible heading or text that includes “About Me”.
The About page no longer renders the current H1 “About Me” heading.

requirements.text: Place the provided hero introduction content at the top of the About page exactly as written (no rewriting, shortening, or paraphrasing), and make the page content start directly with this hero text.

quotes:
Place the following hero content at the top of the About page:

I design analytics systems that executives trust.
I design governed Power BI semantic layers, KPI frameworks, and executive analytics that scale across regions and restore trust in metrics.
If you need analytics that reduce noise, improve adoption, and actually drive outcomes, let’s talk.

→ Chat with me on WhatsApp

Do not rewrite, shorten, or paraphrase this text.

acceptanceCriteria:
At the top of the About page, the hero section displays exactly these 4 lines in this order, with the same punctuation and wording:
1) I design analytics systems that executives trust.
2) I design governed Power BI semantic layers, KPI frameworks, and executive analytics that scale across regions and restore trust in metrics.
3) If you need analytics that reduce noise, improve adoption, and actually drive outcomes, let’s talk.
4) → Chat with me on WhatsApp
No other headings (including “About Me”) appear above or before this hero content.
The displayed hero text matches the user-provided text exactly (character-for-character).

requirements.text: Adjust the About page layout so the title appears immediately below the profile picture.

quotes: The title should appear immediately below my profile picture.

acceptanceCriteria: On the About page, a single title element is rendered directly beneath the profile photo in the profile column/area.
The layout remains readable and visually stable on both mobile and desktop breakpoints.

requirements.text: Remove all booking/scheduling CTAs across the site (including any “Book Appointment”, “Schedule a Call”, “Book a Call”, “Book a Consultation”, or similar) and replace them with a persistent WhatsApp chat entry point.

quotes: Remove any “Book Appointment”, “Schedule a Call”, or similar booking buttons.

acceptanceCriteria: No visible UI elements contain booking/scheduling CTAs (e.g., “Book a Call”, “Schedule a Call”, “Book a Consultation”, “Schedule a Consultation”) in the header, mobile menu, footer, Home page, or any other page.
No remaining links/buttons navigate to the existing external calendar URL currently used in the UI.

requirements.text: Add a persistent WhatsApp chat button visible on all pages (floating/fixed preferred) that opens a WhatsApp chat directly to +923315166680, using the optional pre-filled message: "Hi Imran, I’d like to discuss analytics or BI consulting." The button must not obstruct page content.

quotes: Add a persistent WhatsApp chat button that is visible on all pages.
The button should open a WhatsApp chat directly when clicked.
Phone number: +923315166680

Optional pre-filled message (recommended):

Hi Imran, I’d like to discuss analytics or BI consulting.
Placement can be floating or fixed, but it must not obstruct content.

acceptanceCriteria: A WhatsApp chat button is present on every route/page and remains visible while navigating within the SPA.
Clicking the button opens WhatsApp chat directly to +923315166680 using a WhatsApp deep link (e.g., wa.me or api.whatsapp.com) and includes the provided prefilled message.
On small screens, the floating button does not cover critical interactive elements (e.g., primary CTAs, form submit buttons) and does not block reading of main content.

requirements.text: Perform a mobile responsiveness optimization pass across the entire website to ensure readable typography, mobile-friendly navigation, touch-friendly buttons, and no layout breaks on small and medium screen sizes (Android and iOS).

quotes: Optimize the entire website for mobile phones.
Responsive layout across Android and iOS
Readable typography
Mobile-friendly navigation
Touch-friendly buttons
The site should function smoothly on small and medium screen sizes without layout breaks.

acceptanceCriteria: All pages render without horizontal scrolling on common mobile widths (e.g., ~360–430px) unless intentionally required for a specific component.
Navigation is usable on mobile (menu opens/closes reliably; tap targets are comfortably touchable).
Body text and headings remain readable on mobile without overlapping, clipping, or excessive truncation.
Key buttons/links meet touch-friendly sizing expectations and are not too close together on mobile.

requirements.text: Deliver these changes as a draft-only update for review and do not publish/take the site live until explicit user approval is provided.

quotes: Apply all changes in draft mode only.
Do not publish the site yet.
Share the draft with me once ready so I can review and approve before going live.

acceptanceCriteria: A new draft build is produced that includes all requested changes.
No action is taken to deploy/publish the draft to production/live without the user explicitly requesting it.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose only).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
Use the hero intro text exactly as provided; do not paraphrase, shorten, or rewrite.
Remove all booking/scheduling CTAs and their external calendar links from the UI.
WhatsApp phone number must be exactly +923315166680; prefilled message must be exactly: "Hi Imran, I’d like to discuss analytics or BI consulting."
Changes must be prepared in draft mode only; do not publish without explicit approval.
nonGoals: Add new pages or new portfolio content beyond the specified About hero text/layout changes.
Introduce third-party chat widgets or non-WhatsApp messaging channels.
Implement backend-driven contact/chat features (WhatsApp deep link only).
Refactor unrelated architecture issues (e.g., React Query double initialization) unless required to complete the requested changes.

preferencesToAdd: Prefer draft-only releases for review before publishing changes to production.
